direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods are part of the standard Object class contract and are often tested together to ensure consistent behavior.
Both methods involve comparing objects and have similar control flows, especially in terms of handling null values and type checks.
The equals method checks the state of the ComparatorChain, which is related to the locking state managed by the isLocked method.
Both methods modify the internal state of the ComparatorChain, specifically the list of comparators and their ordering bits.
Similar to addComparator, this method also modifies the internal state of the ComparatorChain, affecting the comparators and their ordering.
